DCRModel.title: Application Process for Extended Health Allowance
DCRModel.description: Legal and procedural flow for Danish pensioners applying for extended health allowance, incorporating eligibility, consent, documentation, and treatment-specific rules with strict essentials for process start and order.

events.label: Applicant is properly identified and provides all required consents (privacy law)
Applicant declares exemption from digital self-service, if applicable
Applicant provides required provider quotations and documentation
Applicant submits current wealth statement to Udbetaling Danmark
Applicant submits application for extended health allowance
Municipality receives and reviews application and supporting documents
Municipality requests additional information from provider (with consent)
Udbetaling Danmark provides wealth and income information to municipality
Check that applicant's personal supplement percentage is greater than 0
Check that liquidity (applicant and spouse/cohabitant) is below statutory threshold
Verify dental treatment eligibility (removable dentures vs. fixed, proper calculation)
Verify glasses eligibility (standard types, no progressive/contact lenses, meets criteria)
Verify foot care eligibility (not covered by other legislation, patient is eligible)
Confirm treatment has not been started before decision
Municipality evaluates necessity and full eligibility
Municipality issues decision (approval or rejection)
Municipality grants personal supplement in exceptional hardship
Allowance calculated (85% of minimum/price-agreed/actual cost as per rules)
Allowance is paid to applicant or provider
Municipality registers outcome and shares information as required
Applicant reports changes in personal or financial circumstances
Municipality or Udbetaling Danmark reviews/updates case based on new info
Check or detection: Treatment has already started/completed prior to decision
Applicant submits appeal or request for reconsideration (auxiliary/post-process)

rules.description: No exemption declaration unless applicant is properly identified and has provided consent
No documentation can be provided until identification and consent
No wealth statement submission until identification and consent
No application submission permitted until proper identification and consent
No municipal review can begin until identification and consent are ensured
Eligibility cannot be evaluated without applicant identification and consent
No decision is possible without identification and consent
Application cannot proceed if treatment already started or completed
Municipality cannot process applications if treatment already started
Eligibility cannot be evaluated if treatment already started
No decision can be made if treatment already started
No allowance calculation if treatment has started
No payment if treatment already started
Exemption declaration is required before paper application (if not digital)
Documentation/quotes must be provided before or with application
Wealth statement must be submitted before or with application
Application must be submitted before review
Documentation/quotes must be available for municipal review
Wealth/income info must be obtained before eligibility evaluation
Review must precede eligibility evaluation
Personal supplement percentage must be > 0 prior to evaluation
Liquidity below threshold must be verified before evaluation
Removable denture rules must be checked for dental cases
Standard glasses eligibility must be checked for all optical applications
Foot care eligibility and exclusions must be checked
Treatment must not have started before eligibility evaluation
Eligibility must be fully and correctly evaluated before decision
Personal supplement may be granted in exceptional hardship
Decision triggers allowance calculation per legal formula
Calculated allowance then paid out
Payment triggers information registration/sharing
Reported changes may require review/update
Case review/update can lead to a new decision
Appeal/reconsideration is only possible after decision
